A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Not 'painful to watch' like the prequels (on account of their terrible acting)\, but a lot of missed opportunities and uneven pacing. Rian Johnson is so determined to subvert expectations that you end up with two-and-a-half hours of fake-outs: everything from the title of the film to a B-story that ultimately goes nowhere. It's watchable\, and has a few high points\, but even the Saga's most ardent fans will probably fast-forward through the 20-minute casino scene on repeat viewings.
